attributes.action: A broken promise of 'Cradle to the Grave' health care
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.myglyw.org.uk/index.php?id=4276
Check this our.

We paid our full National ins Contributions from starting work at aged 15, 49 yrs ago.  According to the 1948 act of parliament we were promised 'Cradle to the Grave' care.  We have not had time to prepare for an alternate way of paying for our care.  Our property has been paid for by us and has already been taxed heavily on.  Had we known it was for our future care we wouldn't have struggled so hard to buy it  as we were already paying a third of our salary on taxes.

Please take into account contributions already made when accessing payment for care in our old age.

Surely  this is unlawful or immoral.
